resources.string: Automatically changes your screen\'s brightness to the light around you, when enabled. You can still adjust your brightness level while adaptive brightness is on.\nModify system settings permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_SETTINGS) is required to use this tile.

Display current alarms or set a new one. The tile shows your next alarm, if any is set. The action is compatible with third-party apps that can receive the Android default broadcasts to show and edit alarms.

Set your device to show lock screen content when a notification comes.\nWrite secure settings permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS) is required to use this tile.

Set animations\' scale for animator, transition, and window.\nWrite secure settings permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS) is required to use this tile.
Create your own list of applications to be displayed in a dialog. If only one application is set, it will be launched without displaying the dialog.

Screen will never go to sleep as long as it\'s plugged into a power source.\nWrite secure settings permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS) is required to use this tile.

Set three different levels (high, medium, & low) of brightness to cycle through.\nModify system settings permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_SETTINGS) is required to use this tile.
Open Google\'s proprietary Calculator app, if installed.
Show your calendar\'s events or add a new one. The action is compatible with third-party apps that can receive the Android default broadcasts to show and add calendar events.

Choose a contact\'s number to quickly dial or open the phone app. The action is compatible with third-party apps that can receive the Android default broadcasts to initiate a phone call.\nPhone call permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#CALL_PHONE) is required to initiate a phone call directly from the tile without going through the dialer user interface.
Open the camera app in photo or video mode. The action is compatible with third-party apps that can receive the Android default broadcasts to open the camera in photo and video mode.
View the latest clipping, and save or share it elsewhere.
Turn data roaming on or off.\nWrite secure settings permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS) is required to use this tile.

Enter Android Demo mode. Demo mode allows you to force the status bar into a fixed state, useful for taking screenshots with a consistent status bar state, or with testing different status icon permutations.\nWrite secure settings permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS) and dump permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#DUMP) are required to use this tile.
Change the density of the screen.
Choose a contact to quickly email or open the email app. The action is compatible with third-party apps that can receive the Android default broadcasts to compose and send emails.
Open Android\'s built-in file manager to explore device storage.
Change the font size your device shows.\nModify system settings permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_SETTINGS) is required to use this tile.

Some notifications may appear in a small floating window when the device is active. You can turn it off to avoid disturbances; especially helpful for when watching a video or playing a game.\nWrite secure settings permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS) is required to use this tile.

Hide the status bar, the navigation bar or both for a truly full screen interface system wide.\nWrite secure settings permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS) is required to use this tile.
Open a dialog to add a new note in Google\'s proprietary Keep app, if installed.

Turn location mode on or off or change location accuracy.
High accuracy mode uses GPS, Wi-Fi, cellular networks, and other sensors to get the highest-accuracy location for your device. It uses Google's location service to help estimate your location faster and more accurately.
Battery saving mode estimates your location using low battery-intensive location sources, like Wi-Fi and cellular networks. It uses Google's location service to help estimate your location faster and more accurately.
Device only mode estimates your location using GPS only. It doesn't use Google's location service to provide location information. This mode may use more battery power and take longer to determine your location.
Write secure settings permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS) is required to use this tile.
Securely lock the device. If a screen lock (password, PIN, pattern, etc.) is set, you need to follow the provided unlocking procedure to unlock the device. Device administrator must be activated.

Open Google\'s proprietary Maps app, if installed, showing the current location of the device. This tile makes use of the Google Awareness API (https://developers.google.com/awareness).\nLocation permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION) is required to use this tile.
Android Nougat adds support to display more than one app at the same time: two apps can run side-by-side or with one above the other in split-screen mode. The accessibility service must be enabled.

Turn NFC on or off, or open NFC settings. \nWrite secure settings permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_SECURE_SETTINGS) is required to change NFC state.
Shows a dialog to power off, reboot, reboot recovery, reboot bootloader. To show the system power dialog, the accessibility service must be enabled.
Shows the Android system power dialog to power off or restart your device. The accessibility service must be enabled.
Show the recent apps screen, a system-level UI that lists recently accessed activities and tasks. The accessibility service must be enabled.
Quickly add a reminder to be shown as a persistent notification. Edit or delete the reminder by tapping the notification.
Set the device ringer mode: Normal, Vibrate or Do not disturb. Do Not Disturb access is required to use this tile.
Keep the device awake overriding the sleep timeout setting. To let the device go back to sleep, stop the service or turn the screen off.
Take a screenshot of your device.\nWrite external storage permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE) is required to use this tile.
Open Android\'s hidden or hard-to-find settings.
Put the device to sleep.
Take a look at the time the device has spent sleeping, with details about the capacity of the battery and the charging state.

Change how long it takes for your device\'s screen to go black when you\'re not using it.\nModify system settings permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#WRITE_SETTINGS) is required to use this tile.

Open Google\'s proprietary Street View app, if installed, showing the current location of the device. This tile makes use of the Google Awareness API (https://developers.google.com/awareness).\nLocation permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION) is required to use this tile.
Turn sync on or off, or open sync settings.
Opens a dialog for you to write anything you want, and then copy, share, or discard it.
Start a countdown timer. The action is compatible with third-party apps that can receive the Android default broadcast to create a countdown timer.
Use voice actions to control your device or perform supported actions.
Control device\'s volume streams: alarm, media, ring and call (on voice capable devices). Do Not Disturb access is required to use this tile.

Open a dialog with the current weather conditions, temperature, feels like, humidity and dew point. This tile makes use of the Google Awareness API (https://developers.google.com/awareness).\nLocation permission (https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html#ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION) is required to use this tile.
Start a web search. The action is compatible with third-party apps that can receive the Android default broadcast to initiate a web search.
